snippet: The legal scandal involving Princess Cristina and her husband over money laundering has become a morality tale of excess whose themes are common enough in a country where the receding economic tide after 2008 exposed corruption and mismanagement.
abstract: Legal scandal involving Spain's Princess Cristina and her husband Inaki Urdangarin over money laundering has become morality tale of excess; case's themes are common in country where receding economic tide since 2008 has exposed corruption and mismanagement.

byline.original: By DOREEN CARVAJAL and SILVIA TAULÉS

lead_paragraph: The legal scandal involving Princess Cristina and her husband over money laundering has become a morality tale of excess whose themes are common enough in a country where the receding economic tide after 2008 exposed corruption and mismanagement.

headline.main: In Royal Drama, Spain Sees Its Reality Reflected
headline.print_headline: In Royal Drama, Spain Sees Its Reality Reflected
